subject: RE: [junit] JSP taglib for running tests?
msgSnippet: I m not sure I understand you correctly, but, if all you want to do is run the same set of tests locally and on the server, look at ANT and its junitreport
messageBody:
I'm not sure I understand you correctly, but, if all you want to do is
run the same set of tests locally and on the server, look at ANT and its
junitreport task.

This should help you automate the running of any tests.

Manuel Amago.
mailto:mamago@...

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Peter Dobratz [mailto:dobratzp@...]
>
> Hi all,
>
> I'm in the process of writing a JSP application and I would
> like to run unit tests on the server as well as locally. The
> motivation for this is that invariably, you end up running
> different JVM versions (or architectures at least) on the
> server and locally, which can introduce really annoying bugs.
>
> I was thinking of making a custom taglib for running the
> tests. It would be used similarly to the following:
>
> <mylib:test-output>
> <mylib:test-case testClass="mypackage.tests.UserTest" />
> <mylib:test-case testClass="mypackage.tests.DbConnectTest" />
> <mylib:test-case testClass="mypackage.tests.UtilsTest" />
> <mylib:test-suite testClass="mypackage.tests.SomeTests" />
> </mylib:test-output>
>
> This would then print out an HTML table summarizing the
> results of the unit tests and their success or failure.
>
> I've looked around for existing software to suite this
> functionality, but haven't found an exact match. I looked at
> Cactus (http://jakarta.apache.org/cactus/), HttpUnit
> (http://httpunit.sourceforge.net/) and TagUnit
> (http://www.tagunit.org/). Have I missed > something?
>
> I would
> appreciate any input.
>
> --Peter
